children.name: bring sth to sb’s attention
children.definition: bring sb to sb’s attention/notice to tell sb about sth that they did not know but which they should know:cho ai đó biết cái gì
examples: i am sure that your parents will want to know about this, and i will personally bring it to their attention.
the general medical council cannot investigate every controversial treatment brought to its attention.
it’s been brought to my attention/ notice thattôi đã được biết rằng
it’s been brought to my notice that you’ve expressed your dislike of a certain member of the company.

children.name: let sb know a2
children.definition: let sb know especially spoken to tell someone something important that they need to know or want to know: nói cho ai đó biết
examples: ▪ if you need any help, just let me know.
▪ you mean she just left without letting anyone know?
let sb know about
▪ they said they’d let her know about the job by the end of the week.
let sb know sth
▪ i’ll let you know our new address as soon as i have it.
let sb know (that)
▪ when you get there, will you phone and let me know you arrived safely?
let sb know what/where/how etc
▪ jean tried to get in touch with her husband to let him know what had happened.

children.name: break the news c2
children.definition: break the news (to sb)/ break it to sb to tell sb some bad news or sth that might upset them: báo tin xấu
examples: do you want to break the news or shall i?
she suspected that she had cancer, and that the doctors were trying to break it to her gradually.
after jack’s body was found, a policewoman had to break the news to his mother.
i didn't want to be the one to break the news to him.
break it to sb that
he was wondering how to break it to celeste that their relationship was over.
break the news gently/ break it to sb gentlytell sb sth in a way that does not shock them too much
maybe i should speak to connor first, so he can break the news gently to patrick and mary.
come on, what happened? break it to megently(= in a kind way) .

children.name: tell a1
children.definition: tell/tel/  nói
examples: ▪ if you’d told me earlier i might have been able to do something about it.
tell sb sth
▪ i want you to tell me all the details.
▪ who on earth told you that?
▪ can you tell me the quickest way to the centre of town?
tell sb (that)
▪ she wrote to tell me she was getting married.
▪ we were told that the manager wanted to see us in his office immediately.
tell somebody what/where/who etc nói với ai đó cái gì, ở đâu, ai
▪ just tell me what happened.
▪ can you tell us where the nearest garage is?
tell somebody about something nói với ai đó về cái gì
▪ have you told anyone about this?
▪ one angry passenger claimed travellers were not told about the mechanical problems.

children.name: to tell sb the most recent info
keep sb informed x
children.definition: keep sb informed to give someone regular information about decisions, events etc, so that they know exactly what is happening: báo cho ai đó tin mới nhất
examples: i want to know what you decide, so keep me informed.
keep sb fully/well informed
during the strike, the media kept the public fully informed about the situation.
parents have complained that we are not keeping them very well informed of their children’s progress.
keep sb informed of/about
we’ll be keeping you informed of any new developments.
the doctor should be kept informed about any changes in your child’s condition.

children.name: keep sb up to date b1
children.definition: keep sb up to date to give sb regular information about what has been happening most recently: báo cho ai đó tin mới nhất
examples: we publish a weekly newsletter to keep everyone up to date.
keep sb up to date with/on
she reads the newspaper every day to keep herself up to date with financial affairs
the magazine that keeps you up to date on all the latest in rock and pop

children.name: fill in x
children.definition: fill sb in to tell sb about things that have happened recently, which they do not know about because they have not talked to you for quite a long time or they have been somewhere else: cho ai biết, cho ai thông tin
examples: you didn’t miss much - i’ll fill you in later
fill sb in on
marjorie filled us in on all the latest gossip
please can someone fill me in on anything i’ve missed?
fill sb in on what/where/when etc
bob filled me in on what he had been doing since we last met.

children.name: brief x
children.definition: brief/briːf/  to give sb all the necessary information about a situation, so that they know exactly what is happening or so that they are prepared for something that they have to do: tường thuật
examples: ▪ police officers were briefed before going out to arrest the suspects.
be fully/well briefed tường thuật đầy đủ
▪ make sure that the pr department are fully briefed on their role.
▪ it was clear the witness had been well briefed.
brief somebody on/about something tường thuật cho ai đó về cái gì
▪ you’ll be picked up from here tomorrow night and briefed on what you have to do.
▪ degaulle flew back to england to be briefed about the invasion that was about to begin.
briefing[countable noun] bản tường thuật
▪ the drug squad’s briefing lasted twenty minutes.

children.name: give sb the low-down x
children.definition: give sb the low-down informal to tell someone all the information they need to know about a situation: nói cho ai biết sự thật
examples: ▪ ‘have you heard about the deal with ibm?’ ‘yes, john’s just been giving me the low-down.’
give sb the low-down on
▪ the travel reporter was giving the low-down on the evening’s traffic chaos.

children.name: give sb an update b2
children.definition: give sb an update on to tell sb the things that have happened concerning a particular piece of work, plan, or situation since they last saw you: cập nhật cho ai đó biết về
examples: let me give you an update on the trial.
can you give me an update on any policy changes there’ve been since we last spoke?
jo's just doing an updateonthe mailing list.
i'll need regular updatesonyour progress.

children.name: report b1
children.definition: report to officially tell someone about what has been happening in a particular area of work, especially because it is your job to do so:báo cáo
examples: is there anything to report?
report to sb on sth
nicky reports to me on any new developments in the relevant technological fields.
report back (to sb)
the delegation will report back to congress on the situation inside china.

children.name: keep sb posted c1
children.definition: keep sb posted spokento regularly tell someone the most recent news about
examples: keep sb posted on
i’ll keep you posted on his progress.
keep me postedonanything that happens while i'm away.

children.name: update b1
children.definition: updatespokento tell someone the most recent information about a situation :cập nhật cho
examples: update sb on sth
we'll update you on this news story throughout the day.
can you update me on what’s been happening?

children.name: to tell sb sth that sb else has told you
pass on b1
children.definition: pass on to give someone amessageor someinformationthat another person hasaskedyou to give:chuyển lời
examples: pass on sth (to sb)
could you pass on my thanks for all these lovely gifts?
please pass on my sympathy to mr and mrs stanton.
pass sth on (to sb)
she said she’d pass the message on to the other students.
i’m grateful for everything that has been said today, and i will be sure to pass it on.
if he provided us with any information, no one passed it ontome.

children.name: relay x
children.definition: relay to send or give sb anofficialmessage, a piece of news, information etc which you have received from another person :chuyển tiếp
examples: mendoza relayed the news as soon as he returned to the base.
relay to
the speaker opened the session by relaying some messages to the conference.

children.name: ways of asking sb to tell you sth
tell me a1
children.definition: tell me /ˈtel miː/ spoken:
examples: ▪ tell me caroline, do you trust me?
tell me where/when/how etc
▪ tell me where you left the money.
▪ come in and tell me what the problem is.
tell me about
▪ tell me about thursday night. did you visit mrs berry?
tell me sth
▪ tell me a little about yourself.

children.name: out with it x
children.definition: out with it/ spit it outspoken say this when you are annoyed or angry because sb has not told you sth: nói đi, muốn nói gì nói đi
examples: ▪ i know there’s sth you’re not telling us, so out with it!
▪ his name, cathy, his name! out with it!
▪ what have you done? come on -- spit it out!
▪ are you implying something? spit it out then!

children.name: when a book, notice etc gives info
tell a1
children.definition: tell/tel/  nói
examples: tell sb how/what/where etc
▪ this leaflet tells you how to apply for a driving licence.
tell sb sth
▪ the two dials in the middle tell you the airspeed and altitude.
tell sb (that)
▪ a sign told us it was the highest village in england.

children.name: give a1
children.definition: give to provide information or details about sth: đưa ra
examples: give information/details/instructions etc
▪ the handbook gave full instructions on how to change the oil.
▪ la weekly magazine gives information about what’s on in los angeles every week.
give an account/description/report
▪ the article gave a vivid account of life after the earthquake.
give sb information/details etc
▪ the footprint could give police crucial details about the man’s shoe size and probable weight and size.

children.name: say b1
children.definition: say to give a particular piece of information about sth: viết
examples: say sth about sth
what does the guidebook say about the opera house?
it says here (that)it is written here that nó được viết ở đây rằng
it says here that the police are closing in on the killer.

children.name: to let sb know sth indirectly
give sb to understand x
children.definition: give sb to understand (that) formal to make sb think that something is true, or that something will happen, but without actually saying this clearly: khiến ai đó nghĩ rằng
examples: a friend of your daughter’s gave us to understand that you lived in michigan
although i received no official indication, i was given to understand that i would be promoted within a year.

children.name: not in so many words x
children.definition: not in so many words if sb lets you know sth shocking, bad, or unkind, but not in so many words, they let you know that it is true without saying it directly: không nói thẳng ra
examples: ‘did sarah tell you she was leaving?’ ‘not in so many words, no.’

children.name: make sth known x
children.definition: make sth known to let sb know sth without telling them directly, for example by behaving in a particular way or by telling sb else who you know will then tell the person:
examples: the queen made her displeasure known by cancelling her visit.
make your feelings/views/wishes known
▪ people without the right to vote were often able to make their feelings known through demonstrations or riots.
make it known that
▪ the other boys in steven’s class took every opportunity to make it known that he was not accepted.

children.name: official c2
children.definition: officialadjective
examples: if a piece of information is official, it has been announced publicly with authority
_their engagement is now official.
_inflation has fallen below 2%, and that's official.

children.name: by/from all accounts c1
children.definition: by/from all accounts
examples: as said by most people
_by all accounts,san franciscois a city that's easy to fall in love with.

children.name: declare b1
children.definition: declareverbexpress khai (hàng hoá để đóng thuế)
examples: [ t ] to officially tell someone the value of goods you have bought, or the amount ofmoney you have earned because you might have to pay tax
_nothing to declare.
_goods to declare.

children.name: give a2
children.definition: giveverbgave,givenprovide rao;công bố
examples: [ t ] to tell someone something
_the winner's name was given(out)/they gave the winner's name(out)on the news.
_[ + two objects ]can you give jo a message for me?

children.name: notify c1
children.definition: notify formal to officially or formally give important information to sb, especially by telling them about sth that has happened or that will happen: thông báo, báo cáo
examples: passengers are requested to notify a member of staff if they see suspicious packages.
notify sb of sth
police notified the boy’s parents of his death immediately.
notify sb that
staff were notified several months in advance that they would be losing their jobs.

children.name: inform b1
children.definition: inform to officially or formally give sb information about sth: thông báo, báo
examples: do you think we ought to inform the police?
they decided to inform the police
inform sb about/of sth
please inform us of any change of address as soon as possible.
you should inform your bank of any change of address.
doctors should inform patients about the possible side effects of any drugs they prescribe.
inform sb (that)
we regret to inform you that your application has been rejected.

children.name: misinform c1
children.definition: misinformto tell sb information that is not correct : báo tin tức sai
examples: be misinformed
i was told she would be at the meeting, but clearly i was misinformed.
i am afraid you’ve been misinformed.
